intro: Laseguea leptocarpa, commonly known as the slender-stemmed laseguea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral morphology and ecological adaptations.
